definition-item.definition-title: ROOF COVERINGS; SKY-LIGHTS; GUTTERS; ROOF-WORKING TOOLS (coverings of outer walls by plaster or other porous material E04F13/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Roof coverings including any similar kind of watertight covering against rain, snow, hail, or the like for other parts of buildings; sky-lights for flat or sloped roofs; roof drainage and gutters; roof-working tools
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Coverings of outer walls by plaster of other porous material

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Solar heat collectors on roofs
Photovoltaic panels on or for roofs

definition-item.definition-title: Roof covering by making use of tiles, slates, shingles, or other small roofing elements (roofing supports {or underlayers} E04D12/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Small roof covering elements, like grooved or vaulted tiles, slates, shingles (E04D1/02 - E04D1/22); Special small roof covering elements characterized by their structure or their purpose (E04D1/24 - E04D1/30); Fastenings for small roof covering elements and devices for sealing the spaces between small roof covering elements (E04D1/34 - E04D1/365).
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roofing supports and under-layers

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Solar heat collectors in the form of shingles or tiles
Photovoltaic panels on or for roofs

section-body.paragraph-text: Use E04D1/00 - E04D1/36 to classify the additional non-inventive aspects

definition-item.definition-title: Grooved or vaulted roofing elements (E04D1/28, E04D1/30 take precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Small grooved or vaulted roof covering elements, like Spanish, Roman or Barrel tiles
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roofing elements comprising two or more layers, e.g. for insulation
Special roof-covering elements, e.g. ridge tiles, gutter tiles, gable tiles, ventilation tiles

section-body.paragraph-text: Classify in E04D1/04 - E04D1/10 if the materials of the roofing elements are specified and in E04D1/02 if they are not.
Classify according to the composition of the roofing elements and their geometry

definition-item.definition-title: Roofing elements shaped as plain tiles or shingles, i.e. with flat outer surface (E04D1/28, E04D1/30 take precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Small roof covering elements having a flat outer surface, like plain tiles, shingles or slates
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roofing elements comprising two or more layers, e.g. for insulation
Special roof-covering elements, e.g. ridge tiles, gutter tiles, gable tiles, ventilation tiles

section-body.paragraph-text: Classify in E04D1/14 - E04D1/22 if the materials of the roofing elements are specified and in E04D1/12 if they are not.
Classify according to the composition of the roofing elements and their geometry.

definition-item.definition-title: Roofing elements with cavities, e.g. hollow tiles (E04D1/28 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Small roof covering elements having internal cavities in the thickness of the roof covering elements, e.g. hollow tiles
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roofing elements comprising two or more layers, e.g. for insulation

definition-item.definition-title: Roofing elements comprising two or more layers, e.g. for insulation

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Roofing elements comprising two or more layers, the layers having a thickness and not being simple coating layers
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Layered products

definition-item.definition-title: {with spacing or space-forming features, e.g. braces, fillers or drains}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Means for connecting or fastening adjacent roofing elements, with the additional purpose of forming a space in between said roofing elements.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Strips covering the gap between roof-covering elements while fastening the roof-covering elements to support elements
Sealing strips between lateral sides of roof-covering elements

definition-item.definition-title: Special roof-covering elements, e.g. ridge tiles, gutter tiles, gable tiles, ventilation tiles (E04D3/40 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Special small roof covering elements, characterized by their special purpose, like ridge tiles, turfing tiles, gutter tiles, gable tiles, ventilation tiles, special tiles allowing walking on the roof
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Slabs or sheets locally modified for auxiliary purposes
Sky-lights; domes; ventilating sky-lights
Junction of roof sheathings to chimneys or other parts extending above the roof

section-body.paragraph-text: Reference E04D3/40 is non-limiting in the subgroup E04D1/30. CPC will be updated/corrected once this inconsistency is resolved.

definition-item.definition-title: {Strips covering the gap between the roof covering elements}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Strips fastening the roof-covering elements to an underlying support element, with the additional purpose of covering the gap between roof covering elements.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Means for connecting or fastening adjacent roofing elements with spacing or space-forming feature
Sealing strips between lateral sides of roof-covering elements

definition-item.definition-title: Devices for sealing the spaces or joints between roof-covering elements (sealing joints not restricted to roof-covering elements E04B1/68; {channels at the intersection of roof surfaces E04D13/0445})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices for sealing the spaces or joints between small roof covering elements, like sealing-strips
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Channels at the intersection of roof surfaces
Sealing joints not restricted to roof-covering elements

definition-item.definition-title: {Sealing strips between lateral sides of roof-covering elements}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Means for connecting or fastening adjacent roofing elements with spacing or space-forming feature
Strips covering the gap between roof-covering elements while fastening the roof-covering elements to support elements

definition-item.definition-title: Roof covering by making use of flat or curved slabs or stiff sheets (E04D1/00 takes precedence; built-up roofs E04D11/02)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roof covering by making use of tiles, slates shingles, or other small roofing elements
Strip-shaped roofing elements appearing as a row of shingles
Roof covering by making use of flexible material, e.g. roofing membranes
Built-up roofs
Roofing supports and under-layers
Sunshades; Awnings
Outer covering for walls not suitable for roof covering
Coverings for buildings of particular purpose, e.g. bus shelters
Roof slab elements comprising solar collectors
Roof slab elements comprising solar cells

section-body.paragraph-text: Use E04D3/00 - E04D3/405 to classify additional information

definition-item.definition-title: of plane slabs, slates, or sheets, or in which the cross-section is unimportant (E04D3/35 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Roofing elements consisting of plane slabs, slates, or sheets not having ribs, corrugations or profiles protruding neither from the plane nor from the margins of the roofing element.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roofing slabs or stiff sheets comprising two or more layers, e.g. for insulation

section-body.paragraph-text: Classify in E04D3/04 - E04D3/18 if the materials of the roofing elements are specified and in E04D3/02 if they are not.

definition-item.definition-title: of concrete or ceramics (of asbestos cement E04D3/18)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Plane slabs of asbestos cement

definition-item.definition-title: of glass or other translucent material; Fixing means therefor (fixing glass panes by means applicable to windows E06B3/54)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Roof covering for buildings by making use of plane slabs or sheets of glass or other translucent material.
Fixing means specially adapted therefor.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Sky-lights
Dormer-windows
Fixing glass panes by means applicable to windows

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roof covering for buildings by making use of slabs or sheets of glass or other translucent material having special cross-sections, i.e. curved, corrugated
Greenhouses
Loggias
Curtain walls
Hollow multi-walled translucent panels with integrated webs
Small buildings for limited occupation
Telephone cabinets
Bay windows
Windows

section-body.paragraph-text: Classify in E04D3/08 - E04D3/14 if glazing bars are included. Classify in E04D3/06 either if glazing bars are not included, or if the plane slabs or sheets of glass or other translucent material have some special technical features.
Classify also in E04D3/06 the plane multi-walled plastic roof-panels, even if only implicitly transparent or translucent, e.g. made of a plastic that is known for being transparent.

definition-item.definition-title: with metal glazing bars

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: constructions of roof intersections or hipped ends

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: details of the cross-sections of metallic profiles

definition-item.definition-title: with special cross-section, e.g. with corrugations on both sides, with ribs, flanges, or the like (E04D3/35 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Roofing elements consisting of curved slabs or stiff sheets or of plane slabs or stiff sheets having ribs, corrugations, flanges or profiles protruding from the surface or the margins of the roofing element.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roofing slabs or stiff sheets comprising two or more layers, e.g. for insulation

section-body.paragraph-text: Classify in E04D3/26 - E04D3/34 if the materials of the roofing elements are specified and in E04D3/24 if they are not.

definition-item.definition-title: of glass {or other translucent material}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Roof covering for buildings by making use of curved slabs or sheets or of plane slabs or sheets having ribs, corrugations, etc., the slabs or sheets being made of glass or other translucent material.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roof covering slabs or sheets of glass of other translucent material with specially profiled marginal portions for connecting purposes
Hollow multi-walled translucent panels with integrated webs

section-body.paragraph-text: When glazing bars are present classify also in E04D3/08 - E04D3/14

definition-item.definition-title: of metal

section-body.paragraph-text: If the special technical features disclose only how the metal roofing elements are connected between themselves or in how they are fastened to the underlying roof structure, then classify only in E04D3/36 or in its sub-groups.

definition-item.definition-title: Roofing slabs or stiff sheets comprising two or more layers, e.g. for insulation {(self-supporting roofing slabs laminated with layers of insulating material E04B7/22; insulating devices or arrangements in the roof covering E04D13/16; connecting, fastening of double roof covering E04D3/3608)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Waterproof roofing slabs or stiff sheets either flat or corrugated comprising two or more layers, e.g. for insulation, and used as roof covering.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Connecting, fastening of double roof covering
Insulating devices or arrangements in the roof covering
Multi-layered self-supporting roof slabs, and not generally used as roof covering

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Layered products
Sandwich panels

section-body.paragraph-text: Self-supporting multi-layered roof slabs, also used as roof coverings are classified both in E04B7/20 - E04B7/24 and in E04D3/35 or its sub-groups.

definition-item.definition-title: Connecting; Fastening

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Connecting, in the sense of connecting means to connect adjacent roofing slabs or stiff sheets together along their margins, directly or indirectly, e.g. through a bridging element.
Fastening, in the sense of fastening means to fasten roofing slabs or stiff sheets to the underlying roof structure.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fastenings for attaching small roof-covering elements to the supporting elements
Roof covering slabs or sheets of glass of other translucent material with specially profiled marginal portions for connecting purposes
Multi-layered roofing slabs or stiff sheets comprising insulating layers, and in which the insulating layers of adjacent slabs have cooperating edges
Separate fastening elements fixed to the roof structure and consisting of parts permitting relative movement to the roof structure of the marginal portions of the slabs or sheets
Fastening means for roof coverings made of flexible materials
Apparatus or tools for roof working, for roof coverings comprising slabs or stiff sheets
Connection of slab-shaped building elements with each other
Separate fastening elements for wall coverings
Devices for fastening constructional elements together

section-body.paragraph-text: Fastening means of roofing slabs or stiff sheets, in their fields, to the underlying roof structure are classified in groups E04D3/3601 - E04D3/3608.
Fastening means of the borders of roofing slabs or stiff sheets to the underlying roof structure are classified in groups E04D3/361 - E04D3/369.
Connecting means between adjacent roofing slabs or stiff sheets are classified in groups E04D3/361 - E04D3/369.
In groups E04D3/361 - E04D3/368, additional small fastening elements, e.g. nails, screws, are not considered as separate connecting elements.

definition-item.definition-title: {of roof covering supported by the roof structure with interposition of a insulating layer (E04D3/3607, E04D3/3608, E04D3/361 - E04D3/369 take precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fastening means comprising spacer means adapted to the shape of the profiled roof covering
Fastening means for double roof covering or over-roofing
Connecting means between adjacent roofing slabs

definition-item.definition-title: {the fastening means being screws or nails}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus or tools for roof working, for roof coverings comprising slabs or stiff sheets
Apparatus or tools for fixing roofing slabs or stiff sheets to the roof structure, by nailing, by screwing

definition-item.definition-title: {of roof covering supported directly by the roof structure (E04D3/3607, E04D3/3608, E04D3/361 - E04D3/369 take precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fastening means comprising spacer means adapted to the shape of the profiled roof covering
Fastening means for double roof covering or over-roofing
Connecting means between adjacent roofing slabs

definition-item.definition-title: {the fastening means being screws or nails}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus or tools for roof working, for roof coverings comprising slabs or stiff sheets
Apparatus or tools for fixing roofing slabs or stiff sheets to the roof structure, by nailing, by screwing

definition-item.definition-title: {the fastening means comprising spacer means adapted to the shape of the profiled roof covering}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Fastening means for a profiled roof-covering, comprising spacer means in between the roof covering and the underlying roof structure, the spacer means being adapted to the shape of the profiled roof covering.

definition-item.definition-title: {for double roof covering or overroofing}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Inverted roofs
Insulating of pre-existing roofs

definition-item.definition-title: by specially-profiled marginal portions of the slabs or sheets

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Connecting adjacent roofing slabs or stiff sheets together by specially-profiled marginal portions of the slabs or sheets, e.g. standing seams, optionally with additional fastening of the border of the slabs or sheets to the underlying roof structure.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Connections of slab-shaped building elements, by means between frontal surfaces, i.e. edge surfaces
Joining sheets or panels to one another or to strips parallel to them; in abutting relationship

section-body.paragraph-text: Use E04D3/36 - E04D3/369 to classify additional information.
For multi-layered roofing slabs classify according to the marginal portions of the upper roofing layer of the roofing slabs.

Connections of opaque roofing slabs, by specially profiled marginal portions of the slabs, and in the thickness of the slab, should also be classified in E04D2003/3617; connections of glass, transparent or translucent roofing slabs, by specially profiled marginal portions of the slabs, should be classified in E04D2003/285.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Standing seam
A seam between two adjacent roofing slabs or sheets, consisting of two adjacent and upwardly oriented marginal portions of the two slabs or sheets

definition-item.definition-title: by locking the edge of one slab or sheet within the profiled marginal portion of the adjacent slab or sheet, e.g. using separate connecting elements

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Connecting adjacent roofing slabs or stiff sheets together by specially-profiled marginal portions of the slabs or sheets and by locking the specially-profiled marginal portion of one slab or sheet within the profiled marginal portion of the adjacent slab or sheet, with or without separate connecting means.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Connecting adjacent roofing slabs or stiff sheets together by specially profiled marginal portions of the slabs or sheets by folding of the edges

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: With snap action

section-body.paragraph-text: Additional small fastening elements, e.g. nails, screws, are not considered to be separate connecting elements.
When it is explicit that there is a snap action, E04D3/363 takes precedence
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Locking the marginal portions of the slabs or sheets
Completely limiting movement of the marginal portions of the slabs or sheets in a direction perpendicular to the edge of the slabs or sheets

definition-item.definition-title: with snap action (E04D3/366 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Connecting adjacent roofing slabs or stiff sheets together by specially-profiled marginal portions of the slabs or sheets with snap action, the snap action occurring directly between the two adjacent specially-profiled marginal portions or between at least one specially-profiled marginal portion and a fastening element to the underlying roof structure.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: By closing the space between the slabs or sheets by gutters, bulges, or bridging elements, e.g. strips

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Connecting adjacent roofing slabs or stiff sheets together by locking the specially-profiled marginal portion of one slab or sheet within the specially-profiled marginal portion of the adjacent slab or sheet

section-body.paragraph-text: Connecting means between adjacent roofing slabs or sheets in which there is only a snap action between the slabs or sheets and a bridging element, and not directly between the marginal portions of the slabs or sheets or between said marginal portions and a fastening element to the underlying roof structure, are classified in E04D3/366.

definition-item.definition-title: {by folding of the edges}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Connecting adjacent roofing slabs or stiff sheets together by specially-profiled marginal portions of the slabs or sheets, by folding of the edges of the roofing slabs or stiff sheets, e.g. rolled seams, after the roofing slabs or stiff sheets have been mounted on the roof.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: By forcing together the marginal portions of adjacent slabs or sheets, e.g. crimping, clamping

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Working apparatus or tools for roof covering comprising flexible sheets, e.g. metallic sheets
Connecting metallic sheets by folding

definition-item.definition-title: by simple overlapping of the marginal portions with use of separate connecting elements, e.g. hooks or bolts for corrugated sheets

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Connecting of adjacent roofing slabs or stiff sheets by simple overlapping of the marginal portions, with or without the use of separate connecting elements, e.g. roof-tile like connections and connections allowing movement in a direction perpendicular to the joint.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Connecting by means of standing seams

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Connecting adjacent roofing slabs or stiff sheets together by specially-profiled marginal portions of the slabs or sheets

section-body.paragraph-text: Additional small fastening elements, e.g. nails, screws, are not considered to be separate connecting elements.
For multi-layered roofing slabs classify according to the features of the marginal portions of the upper roofing layer.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Standing seam
A seam between two adjacent roofing slabs or sheets, consisting of two adjacent and upwardly oriented marginal portions of the two slabs or sheets

definition-item.definition-title: by closing the space between the slabs or sheets by gutters, bulges, or bridging elements, e.g. strips

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Connecting of adjacent roofing slabs or stiff sheets by closing the space between the slabs or sheets by structural or non-structural gutters, bulges, or bridging elements, not forcing together the marginal portions of the slabs or sheets, e.g. by caps protecting the connection against the weather, by bridging elements having also a structural function, by non-structural strip like bridging elements inserted into grooves in the thickness of the roofing slabs, by gutters draining the water at the joint between the slabs.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Bridging elements forcing, e.g. crimping or clamping, the marginal portions of adjacent slabs or sheets

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices for sealing spaces or joints between roof-covering elements
Connections of slab-shaped building elements, by means between frontal surfaces, i.e. edge surfaces
Joining sheets or panels to one another in abutting relationship

section-body.paragraph-text: Connections between adjacent roofing slabs or sheets not presenting a gap between the slabs or sheets are also classified in E04D3/366, provided there is a bridging element, e.g. cap, gutter, strip.
Connections between adjacent roofing slabs or sheets through a bridging element exerting a snap action are also classified here.
Roofs having rafters or supporting elements which also perform the function of bridging elements between the roofing slabs should also be classified in this group.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Bulge
separate bridging element

definition-item.definition-title: by forcing together the marginal portions of adjacent slabs or sheets

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Connecting adjacent roofing slab or sheets by forcing together, e.g. crimping or clamping, the marginal portions of the adjacent slabs or sheets.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Connecting by folding of the edges of the roofing slabs or stiff sheets, e.g. rolled seams
Connecting by means of bridging elements not forcing together the marginal portions of adjacent slabs or sheets

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Working apparatus or tools for roof covering comprising flexible sheets, e.g. metallic sheets
Connecting metallic sheets by folding

definition-item.definition-title: by welding of the marginal portions of adjacent slabs or sheets {also by soldering, glueing}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Working apparatus or tools for roof covering comprising flexible sheets, e.g. metallic sheets
Resistance welding of metals
Welding of plastics

definition-item.definition-title: Devices for sealing spaces or joints between roof-covering elements (E04D3/36 takes precedence; sealing joints not restricted to roof-covering elements E04B1/68)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roof-covering elements connecting means; roof-covering elements fastening means
Bridging devices connecting adjacent roofing slabs or sheets and sealing the spaces or joints in between
Bridging devices forcing together the marginal portions of adjacent roofing slabs or sheets and sealing the spaces or joints in between
Sealing joints not restricted to roof-covering elements

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices for sealing the spaces or joints between small roof-covering elements, ridge sealing

definition-item.definition-title: Slabs or sheets locally modified for auxiliary purposes, e.g. for resting on walls, for serving as guttering; Elements for particular purposes, e.g. ridge elements, specially designed for use in conjunction with slabs or sheets {(E04D13/15 and E04D13/174 take precedence; ridge sealing E04D1/36; solar collectors F24S20/67)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Ridge sealing
Gutters
Trimming strips; edge strips; fascias
Ventilation of roof coverings, on the ridge of the roof
Solar collectors on roofs
Photovoltaic devices on roofs

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Drainage of the roof surface
Ventilation of roof coverings

definition-item.definition-title: {Wall copings}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Top wall-plates

definition-item.definition-title: Roof covering by making use of flexible material, e.g. supplied in roll form (using stiff sheets E04D3/00; gravelling of flat roofs E04D7/00 {; granulated roof covering E04D7/005}; built-up roofs E04D11/02)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Roof covering by making use of flexible material of substantial dimensions, like flexible membranes, flexible sheets, flexible foils supplied in roll form
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roof covering using stiff sheets
Gravelling of flat roofs; roof covering exclusively consisting of sealing masses applied in situ
Granulated roof covering
Built-up roofs

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus or tools for roof working, for roof coverings comprising flexible material
Apparatus or tools for handling roofing or sealing material in roll form
Layered products
Roofing felt

section-body.paragraph-text: Use E04D5/00 - E04D5/149 to classify the additional information

definition-item.definition-title: of materials impregnated with sealing substances, e.g. roofing felt

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Roof covering by making use of flexible materials impregnated with sealing substances, e.g. roofing felt impregnated with asphalt or bitumen
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roof covering by making use of compounded or laminated materials, e.g. metal foils or plastic films coated with bitumen
Roof covering by making use of flexible material specially modified, e.g. perforated, with granulated surface, with attached pads

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roofing felt

definition-item.definition-title: by making use of metal foils

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Roof covering by making use of flexible metal foils. like flexible metal foils supplied in roll form
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roof covering by making use of compounded or laminated materials, e.g. metal foils or plastic films coated with bitumen
Roof covering by making use of flexible material specially modified, e.g. perforated, with granulated surface, with attached pads

definition-item.definition-title: by making use of plastics

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Roof covering by making use of flexible sheets, membranes or foils of plastics, like plastic sheets supplied in roll form
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roof covering by making use of compounded or laminated materials, e.g. metal foils or plastic films coated with bitumen
Roof covering by making use of flexible material specially modified, e.g. perforated, with granulated surface, with attached pads

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Producing foils from plastics or substances in a plastic state

section-body.paragraph-text: Asphalt or bitumen are not considered plastics in E04D5/06

definition-item.definition-title: by making use of other materials

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Roof covering by making use of flexible foils, sheets or membranes consisting of materials not covered by groups E04D5/02 - E04D5/06
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roof covering by making use of compounded or laminated materials, e.g. metal foils or plastic films coated with bitumen
Roof covering by making use of flexible material specially modified, e.g. perforated, with granulated surface, with attached pads

definition-item.definition-title: by making use of compounded or laminated materials, e.g. metal foils or plastic films coated with bitumen

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Roof covering by making use of flexible foils. sheets or membranes consisting of compounded or laminated materials, e.g. flexible metal foils or plastic films coated with bitumen
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roof covering by making use of flexible material specially modified, e.g. perforated, with granulated surface, with attached pads

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Layered products

section-body.paragraph-text: Flexible roofing materials impregnated with sealing substances, e.g. roofing felt impregnated with asphalt or bitumen, are not considered compounded or laminated materials in E04D5/10, and are classified in E04D5/02
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Compounded materials
Combination of materials, except flexible roofing materials impregnated with sealing substances

definition-item.definition-title: specially modified, e.g. perforated, with granulated surface, with attached pads

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Roof covering by making use of specially modified flexible foils. sheets or membranes, like flexible foils, sheets or membranes having features that are not continuous in both length and/or width directions, e.g. perforated membranes, or having a surface that is not smooth, e.g. a granulated surface, or having attached pads
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fastening means for roof coverings comprising flexible materials

definition-item.definition-title: Fastening means therefor

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Fastening means for roof coverings comprising flexible materials
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fastening means to fasten roofing slabs or stiff sheets to the roof structure
Flexible roof covering materials specially modified, e.g. perforated, with granulated surface, with attached pads
Apparatus or tools for roof working, for roof coverings comprising flexible material
Devices for fastening constructional elements together

definition-item.definition-title: {Mechanical fastening means}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Mechanical fastening means for flexible roof covering material, like nails, screws, discs, clips, strips perforating or not the flexible material
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Mechanincal fasteners per se, e.g. nails, bolts, screws, discs, clips, if not specially adapted or indicated as fastening means for flexible roof covering material

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus for fixing a flexible material to the roof supporting structure, by nailing, by screwing

definition-item.definition-title: {Discrete fastening means, e.g. discs or clips}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fastening of roofing slabs or stiff sheets to the roof structure, the fastening means being screws or nails

definition-item.definition-title: {not perforating the flexible material}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fastening by gluing
Fastening by welding

definition-item.definition-title: {fastening by gluing}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Fastening of flexible roof covering material by making use of glue or adhesive
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Tools for applying glue in general
Joining sheets or webs of paper, cardboard, metal foil or plastic by adhesives
Gluing of plastics
Adhesive films or foils
Adhesives
Attachment devices using adhesives

definition-item.definition-title: {fastening by welding}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Fastening of flexible roof covering material by welding
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Soldering, welding of metal
Welding of plastics

definition-item.definition-title: Roof covering {exclusively consisting of} sealing masses applied in situ; Gravelling of flat roofs

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Roof coverings where the roof covering layer is formed by sealing masses, e.g. asphalt, bitumen, applied in situ;
Gravelling of roofs by applying loss gravel or granules in situ
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Bituminous sealing masses
Sealing of building surfaces with sealing masses applied in situ
Sealing of building joints with sealing masses applied in situ

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by loose or embedded gravel or granules as an outer protection of the roof covering}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Gravelling of roofs by applying loose gravel or granules in situ, as an outer protection of the roof covering
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Flexible roof covering materials, e.g. membranes or sheets, having a pre-made granulated surface

definition-item.definition-title: Roof covering by using straw, thatch, or like materials (impregnation against incendiary damage B27K)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Impregnation against incendiary damage

definition-item.definition-title: Roof covering, as far as not restricted to features covered by only one of groups E04D1/00 - E04D9/00; Roof covering in ways not provided for by groups E04D1/00 - E04D9/00, {e.g. built-up roofs, elevated load-supporting roof coverings}

residual-references.section-title: References out of a residual place

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places in relation to which this place is residual:

table-column.paragraph-text: Supports for elevated load-supporting roof coverings

section-body.paragraph-text: Use E04D11/00 - E04D11/02 to classify additional information

definition-item.definition-title: {consisting of two or more layers, at least one of the layers permitting turfing of the roof}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Turfing tiles

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Growing turf

definition-item.definition-title: {Supports for elevated load-supporting roof coverings}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Supports, e.g. height-adjustable spacers, for load-supporting roof coverings on roofs, e.g. for elevated terrace floors on flat roofs.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices allowing walking on the roof or in the gutter
Supporting structures for sectional false floors

section-body.paragraph-text: Documents having tiles resting directly on the flat roofing surface without separate supports or spacers between the roofing surface and the tiles, e.g. normal terrace floors on flat roofs, should be classified in E04D11/00.

definition-item.definition-title: Build-up roofs, i.e. consisting of two or more layers bonded together in situ, at least one of the layers being of watertight composition (gravelling of flat roofs E04D7/00; venting or ventilation E04D13/17)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Gravelling of flat roofs
Venting or ventilation of roof coverings

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roof covering by making use of flexible material, e.g. supplied in roll form
Roof underlay membranes

section-body.paragraph-text: Roof covering consisting of only one layer of flexible material should be classified in E04D5/00 - E04D5/149.

Documents having tiles resting directly on the flat roofing surface without separate supports or spacers between the roofing surface and the tiles, e.g. normal terrace floors on flat roofs, should be classified in E04D11/00

definition-item.definition-title: Non-structural supports for roofing materials, e.g. battens, boards (E04D11/02 {and E04D13/16} take precedence; {self-supporting slabs with non-structural supports for roofing materials E04B7/205})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Built-up roofs
Roof covering insulation
Roof constructions consisting of a plurality of parallel similar trusses supporting load-bearing purlins
Self-supporting slabs with non-structural supports for roofing materials

section-body.paragraph-text: Non-structural boards which support battens and/or roofing materials should be classified in E04D12/00.
If the roof battens or roof purlins, as such, have some relevant special feature, then always give a class in E04D12/004.
Use E04D12/00 - E04D12/008 to classify additional information.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roof batten or roof purlin

In an inclined roof, an horizontal profile, e.g. wooden or metallic, for directly supporting the roof covering elements consisting of shingles, tiles, roofing slabs or stiff sheets; the roof battens or roof purlins are supported by the roof rafters, extending in the direction of the roof slope, or on the roof surface, e.g. for a roof made of concrete slabs.

definition-item.definition-title: {Sheets of flexible material, e.g. roofing tile underlay}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Sheets of flexible material, both water/vapour permeable or not, used as roof underlay and not as roof covering
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roof covering by making use of flexible material

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Manufacture of semi-permeable membranes
House wraps, i.e. air or moisture barrier sheets or foils

definition-item.definition-title: {Battens}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Battens for supporting roof covering elements as defined in groups E04D1/00 - E04D3/40, i.e. small roof covering elements, roofing slabs or stiff sheets.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roof constructions consisting of a plurality of parallel similar trusses supporting load-bearing purlins
Self-supporting slabs with non-structural supports for roofing materials

section-body.paragraph-text: If the roof battens or roof purlins, as such, have some relevant special features, then always give a class in E04D12/004

definition-item.definition-title: {Batten-supporting means}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Batten-supporting means located between the roof structure, e.g. rafters, and the battens

definition-item.definition-title: {Ridge-batten brackets}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Specially adapted brackets to support the ridge-batten

definition-item.definition-title: Special arrangements or devices in connection with roof coverings; {Protection against birds;} Roof drainage {; Sky-lights} (ventilation tiles E04D1/30; ventilation slabs E04D3/40; internal channels E04F17/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Provisions against atmospheric, e.g. wind vortex suppression, vegetal or animal influences on roofs (E04D13/002 - E04D13/008); Sky-lights, domes and roof covering aspects thereof (E04D13/02 - E04D13/0358); Roof drainage, roof gutters, down pipes (E04D13/04 - E04D13/08); Special devices or arrangements for roofs, e.g. snow-traps, junctions of roof sheathings to chimneys, roof trimming strips, roof edge strips, fascias (E04D13/14 - E04D13/1585); Insulating devices for the roof covering (E04D13/16 - E04D13/1693); Ventilation of roof coverings (E04D13/17 - E04D13/178)
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Internal channels, e.g. drainage channels, chimneys, air-ducts

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Ventilation tiles
Ventilation roofing slabs
Apparatus or tools for roof working
Solar collectors on roofs
Photovoltaic devices on roofs, e.g. solar

section-body.paragraph-text: References E04D1/30 and E04D3/40 are non-limiting in the subgroup E04D13/00. CPC will be updated/corrected once this inconsistency is resolved.

definition-item.definition-title: {Provisions for preventing vegetational growth, e.g. fungi, algae or moss}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Biocides, plant growth regulators

definition-item.definition-title: {Protection against birds, mice or the like (scaring devices for birds in general A01M29/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Ventilation on the eaves of the roof
Scaring devices for birds in general
Biocides, pest repellants or attractants

definition-item.definition-title: Roof-covering aspects of dormer windows (E04D13/14 takes precedence; structures therefor E04B7/18)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Sealing between the structure of dormer windows and the roof covering
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roof covering aspects of sky-lights
Junctions of roof sheathings to chimneys or other parts extending above the roof

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Structures for dormer windows

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Dormer window
Roof window set in a structure that is protruding from the surface of a sloping roof; the window itself is substantially vertical

definition-item.definition-title: Sky-lights; Domes; Ventilating sky-lights (E04D13/14 takes precedence; structures therefor, {e.g. dormer windows} E04B7/18; {saw-tooth roofs with light-transmission E04B7/12})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Roof sky-lights of flat, domed or vaulted shape, their structures, their mechanisms, their connecting means to the roof structure, their ventilating means, their safety means and other means or accessories therefor
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Junctions of roof sheathings to chimneys or other parts extending above the roof

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roof covering by making use of plane slabs of glass or translucent material
Roof covering by making use of slabs having a special cross-section and made of glass or other translucent material
Saw-tooth roofs with light-transmission
Structures for dormer windows
Windows in general

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Sky-light
Window, roof lantern or oculus placed on the roof of a building and which is horizontal or parallel to the surface of the roof
Dome
Roof window having a domed shape, i.e. being curved along any two perpendicular directions
Vaulted shape
Having the shape of a vault, i.e. being curved along one direction only, like a cylinder

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by a frame for connection to an inclined roof}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Sky-lights or domes having a frame mainly installed in the plane of a sloping roof.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Sky-lights or domes having a curb frame installed in the plane of a sloping roof

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by a curb frame}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Sky-lights or domes having a curb frame installed either on a sloping roof or on a flat roof
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Curb frame
Raised frame, i.e. a frame that raises from the surface of the roof
Curb
Kerb

definition-item.definition-title: {Supports or connecting means for sky-lights of vaulted shape}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Supports or connecting means for all kinds of elongated sky-lights, i.e. comprising sky-lights of vaulted shape, but also saddle-roof like elongated sky-lights

definition-item.definition-title: {provided with ventilating means (roof ventilation F24F7/02)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Ventilation roofing slabs
Junction of roof sheathings to parts extending above the roof with ventilating means
Ventilation of roof coverings not otherwise provided for, e.g. ridge or eaves ventilation
Roof ventilation

definition-item.definition-title: {provided with means for controlling the light-transmission or the heat-reflection, (e.g. shields, reflectors, cleaning devices)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Daylight conveying tubular skylights, with skylight shafts
Light shafts, e.g. for cellars
Window shutters
Window screens affording protection against light

definition-item.definition-title: {Skylight guards, security devices protecting skylights or preventing objects or persons from falling through skylight openings}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Safety or protective measures for persons during the construction of buildings
Shutters, movable grilles for windows
Safety measure against unauthorised opening of windows

definition-item.definition-title: characterised by having movable parts {(preventing the spread of fire A62C3/00; roof structures with movable roof parts E04B7/16; operating mechanisms for sky-lights E05F11/00; automatically acting closers E05F17/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Sky-lights or domes having movable parts for opening and/or closing, e.g. for ventilation or for preventing the spread of fire
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Preventing the spread of fire
Roof structures with movable roof parts
Operating mechanisms for sky-lights
Automatically acting closers
Devices triggered by fire, excessive heat or smoke

definition-item.definition-title: Roof drainage; Drainage fittings in flat roofs, {balconies or the like} (gutter tiles E04D1/30; gutter slabs E04D3/40; {vessels for collecting rainwater E03B3/03;} street gullies E03F5/04)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Drainage in or on the field of the roof, drainage fittings in flat roofs, balconies or the like (E04D13/04 - E04D13/0481) .
Roof gutters, down pipes and accessories therefor (E04D13/064 - E04D13/08)
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Gutter tiles
Gutter slabs
Vessels for collecting rainwater
Street gullies

definition-item.definition-title: {Drainage outlets, e.g. gullies}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Drainage devices located in or on the roof surface or its perimeter for receiving water from the roof surface before it reaches the ground, the devices having limited extension and being only located at specific locations in or on the roof surface or its perimeter, e.g. roof gullies
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Street gullies

definition-item.definition-title: {Drainage channels}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Gutters in or on the roof surface for draining water, e.g. inclined valley gutters

definition-item.definition-title: {Drainage borders, e.g. dripping edges, gravel stops or dispersers}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Trimming strips; Edge strips; Fascias

definition-item.definition-title: {Underroof drainage layers (layers permitting turfing of the roof E04D11/002)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Drainage layers under the outer surface of the roof, e.g. drainage layer under the tiles of a terrazzo style flat roof
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: roofing tiles flexible underlays

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Layers permitting turfing of the roof

definition-item.definition-title: Gutters {(drainage channels on the roof surface E04D13/0445; gutters for greenhouses A01G9/1476)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Roof gutters around the borders of sloping roofs
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Drainage channels on the roof surface, e.g. inclined valley gutters

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus or tools for roof working
Gutters for greenhouses

definition-item.definition-title: Means for fastening gutter parts together

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Connections between gutter and down pipe

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus or tools for roof working; for handling roofing material in roll form

definition-item.definition-title: Hanging means (in combination with means for fastening gutter parts together {E04D13/0685})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Supports connecting gutter to roof
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Supports connecting gutter to roof in combination with means for fastening gutter parts together

definition-item.definition-title: Devices or arrangements for removing snow, ice or debris from gutters or for preventing accumulation thereof

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus or tools for roof working

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices for mechanically removing snow from gutters are classified in E04D13/076

definition-item.definition-title: {De-icing devices or snow melters}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
De-icing devices and snow melters for gutters
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: De-icing devices for roof gullies
Devices for mechanically removing snow from gutters
De-icing devices for down pipes
Snow melters for roofs

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: De-icing of aircraft exteriors
De-icing of aerials
De-icing of electric lines

definition-item.definition-title: {Cleaning tools}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Cleaning tools for roof gutters
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices for mechanically removing snow from gutters

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Brushes in general
Cleaning devices in general

definition-item.definition-title: {Strainers at connection between gutter and down pipe}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Strainers for roof drainage outlets, e.g. gullies

definition-item.definition-title: Down pipes; Special clamping means therefor (clamping pipes in general F16B, F16L)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Down pipes for roof gutters, and clamping means therefor
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Clamping pipes in general
F16B, F16L

definition-item.definition-title: {De-icing devices or snow melters (for drainage outlets E04D13/0409, for gutters E04D13/0762, for down pipes E04D13/08)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Snow melters and de-icing devices on the roof surface
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: De-icing devices and snow melters for roof gullies
De-icing devices and snow melters for gutters
De-icing devices and snow melters for down pipes

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: De-icing of aircraft exteriors
Methods for preventing ice formation on roads
Embedded electrical heating elements in road surfaces
De-icing of aerials
De-icing of electric lines

definition-item.definition-title: Devices or arrangements allowing walking on the roof or in the gutter

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Permanent installation on flat and inclined roofs allowing walking
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Terraces on flat roofs; elevated terraces on flat roofs

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Step tiles
Means for working on roofs, during the construction
Arrangements on buildings for connecting safety-lines, during the construction

definition-item.definition-title: Junctions of roof sheathings to chimneys or other parts extending above the roof

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Internal channels, e.g. chimneys, air-ducts

definition-item.definition-title: {Junctions to walls extending above the perimeter of the roof (trimming strips, edge strips or fascias retaining the roof sheathing E04D13/155)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Junctions of roof sheathings to parts extending above the roof with ventilating means
Junction to walls extending above the perimeter of inclined roofs
Trimming strips, edge strips, or fascias retaining the roof sheathing

definition-item.definition-title: with ventilating means {in junctions of roof sheathings to parts extending above the roof}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Junctions of roof sheathings to chimneys or other parts extending above the roof provided with ventilating means
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Junction to walls extending above the perimeter of flat roofs
Junction to walls extending above the perimeter of inclined roofs

definition-item.definition-title: specially adapted for inclined roofs {(trays for cavity walls E04B1/70)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Junctions of roof sheathings to chimneys or other parts extending above an inclined roof, the junctions being specially adapted for inclined roofs
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Trays for cavity walls

section-body.paragraph-text: Deformable junction strips which are shaped in situ should be classified here, e.g. junction strips made of a deformable material

definition-item.definition-title: {specially adapted to the cross-section of the parts extending above the roof}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preformed junctions specially adapted for inclined roofs and to the cross-section of the parts extending above the inclined roof
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Deformable junction strips which are shaped in situ

section-body.paragraph-text: Classify also in E04D13/1478 when the part extending above the roof has walls, e.g. walls of a chimney made of bricks

definition-item.definition-title: Trimming strips; Edge strips; Fascias; {Expansion joints for roofs (wall copings E04D3/405; drainage borders E04D13/0459; joints in general E04B1/68)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Trimming strips for roofs, roof edge strips, elements for covering the overhang at the eave side, e.g. soffits, or the verge of saddle roofs, roof fascias
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Wall copings
Junctions of roof sheathings to chimneys or other parts, e.g. walls, extending above the roof

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Drainage borders
Joints in general

section-body.paragraph-text: If drainage aspects are present, e.g. weeping holes, classify also in E04D13/0459, E04D13/0459
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fascias
In a sloped roof, vertical covering part of the cornice, i.e. of the roof eaves overhang
Soffits
In a sloped roof, horizontal covering part of the underside of the cornice, i.e. of the roof eaves overhang
Edge strip
Finishing strip around the border of a roof

definition-item.definition-title: with ventilating means {in soffits or fascias; (on the eaves of the roof E04D13/178)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: With ventilating means on the eaves of the roof

definition-item.definition-title: retaining the roof sheathing

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Edge strips or fascias retaining the roof sheathing
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Junctions of roof sheathings to walls, extending above the perimeter of a flat roof
Junctions of roof sheathings to walls, extending above an inclined roof

definition-item.definition-title: covering the overhang at the eave side, e.g. soffits, or the verge of saddle roofs

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Ventilating means in soffits or fascias

section-body.paragraph-text: Fascia boards and soffits coverings are classified in E04D13/158
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: verge of saddle roof
the edge of a saddle (gable) roof at the gable wall

definition-item.definition-title: {covering the verge of saddle roofs (gable tiles E04D1/30)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Gable tiles

definition-item.definition-title: Insulating devices or arrangements in so far as the roof covering is concerned, {e.g. characterised by the material or composition of the roof insulating material or its integration in the roof structure}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Insulation of the roof covering integrated in the roof covering structure, e.g. the insulation being positioned above, between or below the roof purlins; insulation for roofs made of corrugated sheets; insulation applied above the roof covering, e.g. inverted roofs; insulation of pre-existing roofs; insulation of roof coverings, the insulation having provisions for roof drainage.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roofing slabs or stiff sheets comprising two or more layers, at least one of the layers being of insulating material
Self-supporting roof slabs having insulating properties

definition-item.definition-title: {Insulation of the roof covering characterised by its integration in the roof structure (self-supporting insulating slabs E04B7/22, E04B7/225)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roof insulation arrangement in which the insulating material has provisions for roof drainage
Ventilation of roof coverings not otherwise provided for

definition-item.definition-title: {the roof structure comprising a supporting framework of roof purlins or rafters}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: The insulating material being masses or granules applied in situ

definition-item.definition-title: {with means for fixing the insulating material between the roof covering and the upper surface of the roof purlins or rafters}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Roof insulating arrangements in which the insulating material is fixed between the roof covering and the upper surface of the roof purlins or rafters, with or without special fixing means
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Purlins
Battens

definition-item.definition-title: {with means for supporting the insulating material between the purlins or rafters (insulating layers disposed between two longitudinal supporting elements E04B1/7654)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Roof insulating arrangements in which the insulating material is supported between the roof purlins or rafters, with or without special fixing means
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Insulating layers disposed between two longitudinal supporting elements

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Purlins
Battens

definition-item.definition-title: {the means deriving from the nature or the shape of the insulating material itself}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Roof insulating arrangements in which the insulating material is supported between the roof purlins or rafters, by means deriving from the nature or the shape of the insulating material itself, e.g. expanding insulation.

definition-item.definition-title: {the roof structure being formed by load bearing corrugated sheets, e.g. profiled sheet metal roofs}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Roof insulating arrangements in which the insulating material is supported by load bearing corrugated sheets, e.g. profiled sheet metal roofs
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: The insulating material being masses or granules applied in situ
Insulating of pre-existing roofs with or without ventilating arrangements

definition-item.definition-title: {Double skin roofs}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Insulation for roof coverings comprising a double skin, i.e. two superposed water tight layers
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roofing slabs comprising two or more layers
Fastening means for double roof covering or over-roofing

definition-item.definition-title: {Inverted roofs or exteriorly insulated roofs}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Inverted roofs or exteriorly insulated roofs, e.g. in which the insulation is exposed to the weather
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fastening means for double roof covering or over-roofing
Insulating of pre-existing roofs with or without ventilating arrangements
The insulating material having provisions for roof drainage

definition-item.definition-title: {Insulating of pre-existing roofs with or without ventilating arrangements}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: The roof purlins or rafters being mainly insulated from the interior
The insulating material being masses or granules applied in situ

definition-item.definition-title: {the upper surface of the insulating material forming an inclined surface}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Roof insulating arrangements in which the upper surface of the insulating material forms an inclined surface, e.g. sloped insulating elements on a flat roof

definition-item.definition-title: Ventilation of roof coverings not otherwise provided for (ventilation of rooms or spaces F24F)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Ventilation of the spaces between the roof covering and the roof structure
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roof ventilation, i.e. ventilation of spaces or rooms located below the roof supporting structure

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Ventilation tiles
Ventilation roofing slabs
Internal channels, e.g. chimneys, air-ducts
Ventilation of rooms or spaces, in general

definition-item.definition-title: {Roof insulating material with provisions for or being arranged for permitting ventilation of the roof covering}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Ventilation of roof coverings provided through roof insulating material having provisions for or being arranged for permitting ventilation of the roof covering, e.g. insulation so arranged that it provides ventilation gaps
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Double skin roofs
Insulated roofs in which the insulating material has provisions for roof drainage

definition-item.definition-title: {on the ridge of the roof}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Ventilation of roof coverings provided through ventilating means located on the ridge of the roof
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Ridge tiles
Roof ridge slabs or sheets

definition-item.definition-title: {on the eaves of the roof}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Ventilation of roof coverings provided through ventilating means located on the eaves of the roof
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Protection against birds, mice, or the like
Ventilating means in soffits or fascias

definition-item.definition-title: Apparatus or tools for roof working

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Apparatus or tools for roof working like e.g. apparatus or tools for removing roof material, for cleaning the roof, for building roof coverings comprising tiles, shingles or the like, for building roof coverings comprising slabs, sheets or flexible material for handling, during construction of the roof covering, roofing or sealing material in roll or bulk form
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices for removing snow, ice or debris from gutters
De-icing devices for gutters
Cleaning tools for gutters
Scaffolds for working on roofs

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Ladders

section-body.paragraph-text: Use E04D15/00 - E04D15/07 to classify additional information

definition-item.definition-title: {for removing roof material (for floor coverings E04G23/006)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Arrangements for removing floor coverings

definition-item.definition-title: for roof coverings comprising tiles, shingles, or like roofing elements {(E04D15/003 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus or tools for removing roof material

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roof covering by making use of tiles, slates , shingles or other small roofing elements

definition-item.definition-title: for roof coverings comprising slabs, sheets or flexible material

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Apparatus or tools for handling, removing or applying slabs, sheets or flexible materials to roofs
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus for handling roofing or sealing material in roll form

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roof covering by making use of flat or curved slabs or stiff sheets
Handling of sheet material

definition-item.definition-title: for handling roofing or sealing material in roll form

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Roof covering by making use of flexible material, e.g. supplied in roll form
Handling of sheet material
